Header: “Ugly Dolls” set tobe released this friday
Content: “Ugly Dolls” is an upcoming American computer-animated musical comedy film directed by Kelly Asbury, produced by Jane Hartwell and Robert Rodriguez, with the screenplay being written by Alison Peck, from a story by Rodriguez. It is based on the plush toys of the same name. The film features the voices of Kelly Clarkson, Nick Jonas, Janelle Monáe, Pitbull, Blake Shelton, Wanda Sykes, Gabriel Iglesias, Wang Leehom, Emma Roberts, B ebe Rexha, Charli XCX, and Lizzo. Moxy (Kelly Clarkson) and her UglyDoll friends travel to the other side of the mountain where Uglyville nestles and finds the town of Perfection, a place where everyone is perfect. There they encounter Lou (Nick Jonas), who gathers recruits to train for perfection and ultimately find a child in the real world. Eventually, the UglyDolls learn that being oneself is more important than perfection when Moxy meets lonely perfect doll Mandy (Janelle Monáe). It is scheduled to be theatrically released in the United States on May 3, 2019, by STX Entertainment.
